message.content:
cs.SD, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV

The paper deals with neural network models that learn to localise a single sound source in the horizontal plane using binaural cues based on limited supervisions. This involves the use of reinforcement rewards from the environment as a source of sparse supervision, which suggests a connection to the sub-categories of cs.SD (Sound), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the coordination of multiple sub-modules to facilitate each other's learning process under limited supervisions, which could relate to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
